meanings.definition: To convert to a particular mission or religious belief.
meanings.sent1: The group worked hard to missionize the new members of their community.
meanings.sent2: The missionaries traveled to remote areas to missionize the indigenous tribes.
meanings.sent3: The aliens tried to missionize the humans into believing in intergalactic travel.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for environmental conservation missionized everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's dedication to education missionized her students to strive for success.

meanings.definition: To carry out a mission or task with a specific purpose.
meanings.sent1: The team will missionize the project to ensure it is completed on time.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers were ready to missionize the rescue operation in the war-torn region.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to missionize the cooking competition with his secret recipe.
meanings.sent4: The detective missionized the investigation to uncover the truth behind the mysterious case.
meanings.sent5: The athlete missionized her training to win the upcoming championship.
